John W. GROVER, Appellant v. UNITED STATES of America, Appellee. No. 11903. United States Court of Appeals District of Columbia Circuit. Argued Feb. 16, 1954. Decided April 15, 1954. ,Mr., T. Emmett McKenzie, Washington, D. C., for appellant. . Mr. Gerard J. O’Brien, Jr., Asst. U. S. Atty., Washington, D. C., with .whom Messrs. Leo A. Rover, U. S. Atty., and Lewis A. Carroll and .Thomas A. Flannery, Asst. U. S. Attys., Washington, D. C., were on the brief, for appellee. Mr. William J. Peck, Asst. U. S. Atty., at time record was filed, Washington, D. C., entered an appearance for appellee.

/ Before CLARK, BAZELON and DANAHER, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

t , We'find no'merit in this appeal from 'a'-conviction on three counts of an indictment. charging lottery law violations .under 22 Il.C.Code,' §§ 1501, 1502, 1504 $951). .....!

Affirmed.
